required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Apremilast Treatment for Pruritus and Quality of Life in Scalp Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 4 Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Study Evaluating the Effect of Apremilast on Pruritus and Quality of Life of Patients With Moderate-to-severe Scalp Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: A phase 4 multicenter, randomized, placebo-controlled Study evaluating the Effect of Apremilast on Pruritus and Quality of Life of Patients with moderate-to-severe Scalp Psoriasis

detailed_description.textblock:
The scalp is the most frequently affected body region in psoriasis. Scalp Psoriasis can impair the quality of life greatly due to pruritus. This is however not usually investigated as a primary outcome of treatments.
This study will investigate the effects of apremilast on the pruritus and quality of life and other patient reported outcomes in patients with scalp psoriasis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.description: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index, modified to measure in percentages
Physicians Global Assessment of the Scalp (0 - 5)
Skin related Quality of life (0 to 30)
Psoriasis score measuring intensity on the scalp

intervention.description: Indistinguishable tablets not containing apremilast, Placebo Oral Tablet

facility.name: Department of Dermatology, University Hospital Zurich
